alert.note: Alert for Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 07 at 7:40AM CDT until June 07 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL PONTOTOC COUNTY... At 740 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Ada, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ada, Stonewall, Fitzhugh, Fittstown and Jesse. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
